DOC.brief_summary: In this retrospective analysis investigators will study the effects of using a minimally invasive hemodynamic monitoring (FloTrac-Edwards) on postoperative outcomes. Participants will compare a control group to a case group; in both groups ASA 1 patients suffering from advanced ovarian cancer underwent radical cytoreductive surgery. In case group hemodynamic was managed by using the FloTrac system; in the control group a standard hemodynamic monitoring was used.
DOC.brief_title: Fluid ORiented Therapy for yoUNg Asa 1patients
DOC.criteria: ASA 1 cardiac diseases pulmonary diseases renal diseases metabolic disorders
